original_data.question: A 62-year-old woman with a pancreatic insulinoma is being prepared for a laparoscopic enucleation of the tumor. After induction of general anesthesia, preparation of a sterile surgical field, and port placement, the surgeon needs to enter the space posterior to the stomach to access the pancreatic tumor. Which of the following ligaments must be cut in order to access this space?

model_response:
The gastrohepatic ligament is the only ligament listed that is located posterior to the stomach. The phrenoesophageal ligament is located inferior to the esophagus and the phrenicocolic ligament is located at the inferior border of the colon. The ligamentum venosum is a ligament that is only present during fetal development and is not found in adults.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
A benign tumor of the PANCREATIC BETA CELLS. Insulinoma secretes excess INSULIN resulting in HYPOGLYCEMIA.

A procedure in which a laparoscope (LAPAROSCOPES) is inserted through a small incision near the navel to examine the abdominal and pelvic organs in the PERITONEAL CAVITY. If appropriate, biopsy or surgery can be performed during laparoscopy.
New abnormal growth of tissue. Malignant neoplasms show a greater degree of anaplasia and have the properties of invasion and metastasis, compared to benign neoplasms.
The act of bringing about something.
Procedure in which patients are induced into an unconscious state through use of various medications so that they do not feel pain during surgery.
The act or process of making something ready.
A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.
Medical practitioners qualified to practice surgery.
An empty area; an area set apart or available for use.
Pertaining to the back or upper surface of the body; opposite of ventral.
An organ of digestion situated in the left upper quadrant of the abdomen between the termination of the ESOPHAGUS and the beginning of the DUODENUM.

Tumors or cancer of the PANCREAS. Depending on the types of ISLET CELLS present in the tumors, various hormones can be secreted: GLUCAGON from PANCREATIC ALPHA CELLS; INSULIN from PANCREATIC BETA CELLS; and SOMATOSTATIN from the SOMATOSTATIN-SECRETING CELLS. Most are malignant except the insulin-producing tumors (INSULINOMA).
Shiny, flexible bands of fibrous tissue connecting together articular extremities of bones. They are pliant, tough, and inextensile.
An empty area; an area set apart or available for use.
